alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wayne and western Pulaski Counties through 1230 PM EST... At 1159 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cains Store to near Parnell to 7 miles west of Cabell to 6 miles west of Byrdstown. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Magnum, Cains Store and Pointer around 1205 PM EST. Naomi, Parnell, Faubush and Stab around 1210 PM EST. Nancy, Pulaski County Park and Sunnybrook around 1215 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Somerset, Burnside, Hidalgo, Powersburg, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Elihu, Hogue, Slickford, Bronston, Science Hill, Cooper, Mill Springs, Betsey, Monticello, Dabney, Oil Valley, Steubenville, Barrier, Frazer and Burfield. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 24. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
